intro: Hieracium bicolor subsp. legionense, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has basal leaves that are often lobed and covered in fine hairs, and its stems are hairy and somewhat upright. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different flower morphology compared to other members of the *Hieracium* genus.
